snippet: The Times reporters Ashley Parker and Jonathan Martin write that President Obama’s shift on Cuba policy could fill in one of the most enduring fault lines in American politics and reshape the fight to win the vital battleground state of Florida.
abstract: The Times reporters Ashley Parker and Jonathan Martin write that President Obama’s shift on Cuba policy could fill in one of the most enduring fault lines in American politics and reshape the fight to win the vital battleground state of Florida.

headline.main: The Politics of the Shift in Policy on Cuba
